edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service

Class ContainerServiceImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service.AbstractWapService
      • edu.kit.scc.dem.wapsrv.service.ContainerServiceImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ContainerService, WapService

    @Service
public class ContainerServiceImpl
extends AbstractWapService
implements ContainerService
    A general implementation of the container service interface. It is used by the controllers as an interface to the main application. It uses the repository and the model factory to create instances of model objects and manipulate them according to the clients requests prior to storing them in the repository or returning them to the controllers for responses to the clients.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Matthias Dressel, Michael Hitzker, Markus Hoefler, Andreas Loeffler, Timo Schmidt

    • Method Detail

      • deleteContainer

        public void deleteContainer(java.lang.String iri,
                            java.lang.String etag)
                     throws WapException
        Description copied from interface: ContainerService
        Deletes the Container denoted by the given IRI if ETags match A Container can only be deleted if it contains no sub-containers. Contained Annotations do not prevent deletion, they will get deleted too.
        Specified by:
        deleteContainer in interface ContainerService
        Parameters:
        iri - The IRI of the container to delete
        etag - The ETag associated with the container state known to the client
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred

                              java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> preferences)
                       throws WapException
        Description copied from interface: ContainerService
        Gets the Container denoted by the given IRI. Preferences are applied.
        Specified by:
        getContainer in interface ContainerService
        Parameters:
        containerIri - The IRI of the container
        preferences - List of container preferences

        Throws:

      • postContainer

        public Container postContainer(java.lang.String baseContainerIri,
                               java.lang.String name,
                               java.lang.String rawContainer,
                               Format format)
                        throws WapException
        Description copied from interface: ContainerService
        Creates a new Container with the given name as a child to the Container denoted by the baseContainerIri. The Container is serialized as a String in rawContainer with the given Format and constraints.
        Specified by:
        postContainer in interface ContainerService
        Parameters:
        baseContainerIri - The IRI of the container to which the newly created one is added
        name - The name to use for the new container
        rawContainer - The serialized Container
        format - The provided format of the rawContainer
        Returns:
        The created Container
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred

                    int containerPreference,
                    int pageNr)
             throws WapException
        Description copied from interface: ContainerService
        Gets the Page with the given number of the Container denoted by the given IRI. Preference of Annotation representation is applied.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        containerPreference - The preference regarding Annotation representation
        pageNr - The number of the page
        Returns:
        The requested Page
        Throws:
        WapException - In case any errors occurred
